SourceProxy.label: Extract Attributes
SourceProxy.name: AttributeDataToTableFilter

Documentation.long_help: Extract attribute data as a table.
Documentation.short_help: Extract attribute data as a table.

SourceProxy.Documentation: This is a filter that produces a vtkTable from the chosen attribute in the input data object. This filter can accept composite datasets. If the input is a composite dataset, the output is a multiblock with vtkTable leaves.

InputProperty.name: Input
InputProperty.Documentation: This property specifies the input of the filter.

IntVectorProperty.name: FieldAssociation
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: Select the attribute data to pass.

IntVectorProperty.name: AddMetaData
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: It is possible for this filter to add additional meta-data to the field data such as point coordinates (when point attributes are selected and input is pointset) or structured coordinates etc. To enable this addition of extra information, turn this flag on. Off by default.

SourceProxy.label: Merge Blocks
SourceProxy.name: MergeBlocks

Documentation.short_help: Appends vtkCompositeDataSet leaves into a single vtkUnstructuredGrid or vtkPolyData

SourceProxy.Documentation: Merge Blocks appends all vtkDataSet leaves of the input composite dataset to a single unstructured grid (or polydata if all leaves are polydata). The subtree to be combined can be chosen using the SubTreeCompositeIndex. If the SubTreeCompositeIndex is a leaf node, then no appending is required nor performed.

IntVectorProperty.name: OutputDataSetType
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: Determines the output type produced by this filter. Only blocks compatible with the output type will be merged in the output. For example, if the output type is "Polygonal Mesh", then blocks of type "Image Data", "Structured Grid", etc. will not be merged. If the output type is "UnstructuredGrid", then blocks of any type will be merged in the output. Defaults to "Unstructured Grid".

IntVectorProperty.name: MergePartitionsOnly
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: When set, only paritions and pieces will be merged into a dataset each, instead of merging everything into a single dataset.

IntVectorProperty.label: Merge Points
IntVectorProperty.name: MergePoints
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: Merge points within a distance specified by the **Tolerance** property.

DoubleVectorProperty.label: Tolerance
DoubleVectorProperty.name: Tolerance
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: Set the tolerance for merging points if **Merge Points** is enabled.

IntVectorProperty.name: ToleranceIsAbsolute
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: This property determines whether to treat the **Tolerance** property as absolute (points closer than Tolerance are merged) or relative (points closer than a fraction of the input data's bounding box diagonal length) when performing point merging.

SourceProxy.label: Environment Annotation
SourceProxy.name: EnvironmentAnnotation

Documentation.long_help: Allows annotation of user name, date/time, OS, and possibly filename.

SourceProxy.Documentation: Apply to any source. Gui allows manual selection of desired annotation options. If the source is a file, can display the filename.

InputProperty.name: Input
InputProperty.Documentation: Set the input of the filter.

IntVectorProperty.name: DisplayUserName
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: Toggle User Name Visibility.

IntVectorProperty.name: DisplaySystemName
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: Toggle System Name Visibility.

IntVectorProperty.name: DisplayDate
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: Toggle Date/Time Visibility.

IntVectorProperty.name: DisplayFileName
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: Toggle File Name Visibility.

IntVectorProperty.name: DisplayFilePath
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: Toggle Show Full File Path.

InputProperty.name: Input
InputProperty.Documentation: Set the input to the Min Max filter.

StringVectorProperty.name: Operation
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: Select whether to perform a min, max, or sum operation on the data.

Documentation.long_help: Extract a histogram from field data.
Documentation.short_help: Extract a histogram from field data.

InputProperty.name: Input
InputProperty.Documentation: This property specifies the input to the Histogram filter.

StringVectorProperty.name: SelectInputArray
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: This property indicates the name of the array from which to compute the histogram.

IntVectorProperty.name: BinCount
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: The value of this property specifies the number of bins for the histogram.

IntVectorProperty.name: Component
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: The value of this property specifies the array component from which the histogram should be computed.

IntVectorProperty.name: CalculateAverages
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: This option controls whether the algorithm calculates averages of variables other than the primary variable that fall into each bin.

IntVectorProperty.name: UseCustomBinRanges
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: When set to true, CustomBinRanges will be used instead of using the full range for the selected array. By default, set to false.

IntVectorProperty.name: CenterBinsAroundMinAndMax
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: When set to true, first and last bin will be centered around the minimum and the maximum values of the data. By default, set to false.

DoubleVectorProperty.name: CustomBinRanges
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: Set custom bin ranges to use. These are used only when UseCustomBinRanges is set to true.

InputProperty.name: Input
InputProperty.Documentation: Set the input to the Reduction filter.

StringVectorProperty.name: PostGatherHelperName
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: Set the algorithm that takes multiple inputs and produces a single reduced output.

IntVectorProperty.name: ReductionMode

Entry.text: Reduce all data to one processor
Move all data to one processor
Reduce all data to all processors

IntVectorProperty.Documentation: Set the reduction mode. Reducing all data to one processor means that the destination process will have all data while each other process will still have it's own data. Moving all to one processor means that the destination process will have all data while other process have no data anymore. Reduce all data to all processors is self explanatory.

IntVectorProperty.name: ReduceTo
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: Set the process to reduce to.

IntVectorProperty.name: OnlyFrom
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: If set to a non-negative value, then produce results using only the node Id specified.

IntVectorProperty.name: GenerateProcessIds
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: If true, the filter will generate vtkOriginalProcessIds arrays indicating the process id on which the cell/point was generated.

InputProperty.name: Input
InputProperty.Documentation: Set the input to the Reduction filter.

Entry.text: Move all data to one processor
Reduce all data to one processor
Reduce all data to all processors

StringVectorProperty.name: PreGatherHelperName
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: Set the algorithm that runs on each node in parallel.

StringVectorProperty.name: PostGatherHelperName
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: Set the algorithm that takes multiple inputs and produces a single reduced output.

IntVectorProperty.name: PassThrough
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: If set to a non-negative value, then produce results using only the node Id specified.

IntVectorProperty.name: GenerateProcessIds
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: If true, the filter will generate vtkOriginalProcessIds arrays indicating the process id on which the cell/point was generated.
